articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Domestic flights were cancelled and almost 3,000 people were evacuated as Taiwan girded for the arrival of Typhoon Haikui on Sunday, which is expected to bring torrential rain and strong winds to the island's south and east.
articles.title: Typhoon Haikui prompts Taiwan to evacuate thousands, cancel flights

articles.author: Philip Pullella
articles.description: Pope Francis on Sunday sent greetings to China, calling its citizens a "noble" people and asking Catholics in China to be "good Christians and good citizens," in his latest overture to the communist country to ease restrictions on religion.
articles.title: In overture to China, pope sends greetings to a 'noble' people

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a 3 1/2-hour drone attack on the southern parts of the Odesa region early on Sunday, hitting a Danube River port infrastructure and injuring at least two people, Kyiv said.
articles.title: Russian drone attack in Odesa region hits Danube port infrastructure - Ukraine

articles.author: Cynthia Kim
articles.description: North Korea conducted a simulated "tactical nuclear attack" drill on Saturday that included two long-range cruise missiles, state media reported on Sunday, as leader Kim Jong Un inspected shipbuilding and munitions factories.
articles.title: North Korea stages 'tactical nuclear attack' drill

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin will focus on the Black Sea grain deal during their meeting on Monday as Turkey seeks to bring Moscow back to the deal, Erdogan's chief foreign policy advisor said.
articles.title: Erdogan's Russia visit vital for grain deal, Turkish leader's chief aide says

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Armenia's prime minister has said his country's policy of solely relying on Russia to guarantee its security was a strategic mistake because Moscow has been unable to deliver and is in the process of winding down its role in the wider region.
articles.title: Armenian PM says depending solely on Russia for security was 'strategic mistake'

articles.author: Arpan Chaturvedi, Rupam Jain
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi called on the United Nations to reform in line with 21st century realities to ensure the representation of voices that matter, according to an interview published on Sunday.
articles.title: India PM urges UN to rethink priorities for the 21st century

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden was in northern Florida on Saturday, surveying the damage caused by Hurricane Idalia and comforting people affected by the storm, though he had no plans to meet with Ron DeSantis, the state's Republican governor and a potential presidential rival.
articles.title: Biden surveys storm damage in Florida, will not meet with DeSantis

articles.author: Wa Lone, Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: A deal Canada struck this year to stem the flow of asylum seekers entering from the U.S. was, at first glance, a quick success: Within days, the number of people caught at unofficial crossings along the border dwindled to a trickle.
articles.title: Canada shut its land border to asylum seekers. More refugees came anyway

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday appeared to shift blame to his top diplomat for the disclosure of a secret meeting with the Libyan foreign minister that has caused a backlash in Tripoli.
articles.title: Netanyahu rues his foreign minister's disclosure of meeting with Libyan counterpart
